result.execSummary:
The defendant Kali L Short was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater, Penalty - Retail Theft (>$500 - $5000)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary, including any statutorily authorized surcharges, joint and several with co-Defendant. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

5/15/14 Restitution amount has been added.
No contact direct or indirect with victim and co-Defendant. Not to enter any stores without DOC's approval.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: 60 days of sentence are stayed to be used at discretion of Court through Petition of Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted. 1 week to report.  Consecutive to case no. 09-CF-123.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kali L Short in court with attorney Steven G Richards.  Defendant Kali L Short in custody.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews max. penalties, elements, party to a crime. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing and/or restitution. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations.  Bond no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas.  Bond continues as is.  Defense requests that sentencing after revocation be scheduled at same time.

Defendant Kali L Short in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Kali L Short in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 26, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
No contact direct or indirect with SM, Sturgeon Bay Wal-Mart.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Kali L Short in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Kali L Short in custody. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
